content:
OracleNumber Struct

In this Article

Represents a fixed precision and scale numeric value between -10 27 -1 and 10 27 -1 to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

Syntax

Declaration

public struct OracleNumber : IComparable, System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • OracleNumber

Remarks

To obtain an OracleNumber object, call the GetOracleNumber method.

Oracle numeric data types can store up to 27 decimal digits of precision. When converting Oracle numeric values to common language runtime data types, the Oracle value might be too large. Conversely, when converting a numeric value of a common language runtime data types to an OracleNumber, the numeric value may be either too large or too high precision for the OracleNumber. Either of these cases will cause an Oracle ORA-22053 overflow error. If your Oracle database might contain large values, you should use the OracleNumber data type. You can then convert to the common language runtime data type explicitly, and catch or handle any errors.

Initializes a new instance of the OracleNumber structure using the supplied OracleNumber.

Initializes a new instance of the OracleNumber structure using the supplied Decimal value.

OracleNumber(Int64)

Initializes a new instance of the OracleNumber structure using the supplied long integer value.

  • E

    Returns the value e-2.718.

    public static readonly System.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber E;

    Remarks

    E is useful for performing scientific calculations or as a parameter value.

  • MaxPrecision

    A constant representing the largest possible value for precision comparison.

    public static readonly int MaxPrecision;

    Remarks

    The value of this constant is 38.

  • MaxScale

    A constant representing the maximum value for scale comparison.

    public static readonly int MaxScale;

    Remarks

    The value of this constant is 127.

  • MaxValue

    A constant representing the maximum value of an OracleNumber structure.

    public static readonly System.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber MaxValue;

    Remarks

    The value of this constant is 9.9999999999999999999999999999999999999E+125. This number has a greater precision than what a common language run-time Double data type can contain. If you attempt to store this value in a Double, the value is rounded up to 1E+126. The maximum Double value that can be used in the OracleNumber (Double) constructor is: 9.99999999999999E+125.

  • MinScale

    A constant representing the minimum value for scale comparison.

    public static readonly int MinScale;

    Remarks

    The value of this constant is -84.

    MinusOne is useful for performing calculations or as a parameter value.

    The value of this constant is -9.9999999999999999999999999999999999999E+125.

Properties

  • IsNull

    Indicates whether or not the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber.Value* of this OracleNumber structure is null.

    public bool IsNull { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber.Value* is null, otherwise false.

  • Value

    Gets the value of the OracleNumber structure. This property is read-only.

    public decimal Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • Decimal

      A number in the range -79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 through 79,228,162,514, 264,337,593,543,950,335.

    Remarks

    If you attempt to retrieve a value outside the allowable range, Oracle returns the "OCI-22053: overflow error" message. Use the ToString method to retrieve such values.

rawMetadata.title: OracleNumber struct | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents a fixed precision and scale numeric value between -10 27 -1 and 10 27 -1 to be stored in or retrieved from a database.
